texts: ALL GOVERNMENT SERVICES UNDER ONE ROOF
We must handle official documents in Damascus from anywhere in the world quickly and reliably.

homethree.title: Who We Are
homethree.subtitle: About Our Company
homethree.description: Absher Service is a company specializing in paperwork and administrative transactions in Syria, enabling individuals and businesses to complete official procedures remotely from anywhere in the world. Our goal is to become the leading company in this field, providing clear, reliable, and efficient solutions that save time and effort, eliminating the need for travel.

homefive.q1: What government services do you provide?
homefive.a1: At our company, we provide all the government services offered by the Syrian Arab Republic for all paper-based transactions, including licenses, official documents, attestations, and other administrative procedures, ensuring a smooth and convenient process for citizens and clients.
homefive.a4: Our working hours are from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM.
homefive.q5: Can you help with urgent requests?
homefive.a5: Yes, we can assist with urgent requests and ensure that all time-sensitive transactions are handled promptly and efficiently.
homefive.q6: Are your services compliant with local regulations?
homefive.a6: Of course, all our services are fully compliant with local regulations, ensuring that every transaction is legal and meets all governmental requirements.

Personal identity.
Completion time: two weeks.
Estimated fees: 10,000 SYP.
Present a birth certificate from the hospital or licensed midwife.
Presenting the family book to the parents.
If more than a year has passed since the birth, a court order is required.
The event must be registered in the civil status records within 30 days of the date of birth within the country.
A marriage contract certified by the Sharia or Church court.
Personal identification cards of the couple or a civil registration statement.
Recording the incident in the civil marriage record.
The family book is then issued.
A divorce decree issued by the Sharia court.
Present the family book and personal identification documents of the couple.
The incident is recorded in the civil records of the husband and wife, and the civil registration data is updated.
A death certificate from the hospital or doctor, duly certified.
The deceased's relatives' identities and family Register.
Registration must be completed at the Civil Status Department of the place of the incident within 30 days (within the country).
If the death is not officially registered for a year or more, a court order is required.
Individual Civil Registration Statement: Shows marital status (single, married, divorced) with place and date of birth.
Personal identity.
It is issued immediately or within one day.
This includes all family members registered under marriage.
Personal identity.
It is issued immediately or within one day.
Personal identity.
Released immediately.
Submit a formal application.
Attach a civil registration statement, personal ID, and family book.
Approval of the Director General of Civil Status.
Processing time: about two weeks.

requirements: The father's personal identity or civil registration record.

Fill out the personal information and attach an ID card or an attested recent Civil Status Extract.
Attach 2 personal photos with white background.
Choose the type of service (Ordinary - Urgent - Instant) and pay the applicable fees.
The Financial fees for the instant service are 1,600,000 SYP.
Contact the Syrian embassy or consulate in the country of residence, typically reservation and registration are via the electronic platform.
The ID card or the attested Civil Registration certificate beside the personal images and proof of residency should be attached.
Payment of fees: USD 400 for the instant service, and USD 200 for the Ordinary service.
Submit a renewal application or attach your ID and personal photos, and select whether the application is urgent or regular.
In case of an error in the name or personal information, submit a correction request and attach a copy for the ID or civil record.
In the event of a lost or damaged passport, a formal report must be filed with the competent authorities.
Provide your ID, personal photos, a police report (if required) and proof of residence if abroad.
Pay the applicable fees for the replacement due to loss or damage.

Personal identification of the landlord and tenant, or a duly certified legal power of attorney.
Purchase of an executive document that includes a financial stamp form and tax assessment.
A stamp duty of 10% of the rental value must be paid.
The landlord's fingerprint for clearance and financial survey, and a property inspection by the finance department.

Obtaining a tax identification number (TIN) for the tenant.
Pay a tax advance according to the type of business activity that the tenant will be practicing.
Ratification of the contract or referral to the governorate for implementation.

TravelAgencyLicense.service: Travel Agency/Tourism Office License (Organizing trips and booking tickets)
requirements: A written application for a license addressed to the Ministry of Tourism, explaining the activity required.
A property registration statement / title deed or certified lease agreement for the office location, commercial property ≥ 30 m².
A 5-year lease, or investment contract, or a 1-year lease with notarized undertaking to extend for 5 years.
Sketch of the site and description of the place.
Copy of personal identification of office owner or partners.
Criminal record (no convictions).
Non-employee document.
Field inspection conducted after submission of initial documents.
Founding budget and initial capital ≥ 10,000,000 SYP.
Bank guarantee worth 25,000,000 SYP.
Appoint two employees registered with social security and labor.
Images of employees' academic certificates and personal IDs.
Membership application in the tourist register and registration in the Chamber of Tourism.
Payment of service and administrative fees: 150,000 SYP - 300,000 SYP.
Approximate costs for licensing: Bank guarantee: 25,000,000 SYP, Start-up budget: 10,000,000 SYP, Lease: 6,000,000 SYP, Administrative fees: 150,000 - 300,000 SYP.
Syrian nationality or equivalent status.
Age ≥ 22 years.
University degree or equivalent (or intermediate institute degree depending on specialization).
No felony or dishonorable misdemeanor convictions.
Not employed by the state.
Required documents: Copy of personal ID, Criminal record, Non-employee document, Certified educational certificate, Six personal photos, Proof of residence.
Proficiency in spoken and written English.
Application submitted to Directorate of Tourism with technical examination and Ministry training course.
Fees range: 800,000 SYP - 2,500,000 SYP.

TouristAccommodationLicense.service: License for a tourist accommodation establishment (hotel)
requirements: Official request to the Minister of Tourism to establish and operate a tourist hotel.
Approved site plans showing rooms, spaces, and design.
Document proving land ownership, certified lease, or investment contract.
Technical and economic study including investment costs, workers, expected services.
Investor's Guide / Guide to Initial Technical Qualification Application.
Trial operational manual to assess readiness before final licensing.
List of workers and employees, Certified employment contracts, Registration with social security and employment.
Statement of readiness of basic services (electricity, water, internet, waste management).
Health and safety certificate from Ministry of Health, Civil Defense certificate for safety requirements.
Security and safety documentary plans.
Hotel rating determined by ministry after final inspection.
Copy of personal IDs of applicant and partners.
Bank account in hotel's name.
Costs vary by location, classification, and operating costs, approx. 10,000,000 - 100,000,000 SYP including administrative fees.
Customs certificate (for imported vehicles).
Vehicle registration application.
Copy of owner's personal identification.
Vehicle tax identification number (commercial vehicles).
Vehicle technical inspection report.

Traffic clearance certificate.
Valid mandatory insurance policy.

requirements: Public transport (taxis and buses).

Government vehicles via official correspondence.
Agricultural vehicles: partial exemptions.
Discoloration.
Converting vehicle category.

Modify operation type (subject to technical committee approval).

Review by Directorate of Transportation.
Initial registration: Registration of a property that has not previously been registered in the real estate registry.
Transfer of ownership: sale, purchase, gift, exchange, and transfer of ownership between relatives.
Establishing informal sales contracts: through a court ruling or by mutual agreement.
Registering the inheritance and transferring ownership to the heirs based on the inheritance inventory.
Establishing ownership through court rulings: confirming a sale, removing joint ownership, and establishing ownership.
Documents required for registering and transferring real estate ownership (sale - gift - exchange - inheritance - court ruling) and for issuing the title deed (Tabu):
Seller's (owner's) and agent's identity: (original and copy).
The original sales contract or previous title deed.
Certified property registration statement.
Receipts for payment of property sales tax.
Financial clearance certificate (municipal).
Property plan / Area statement for residential or agricultural properties.
Inheritance inventory and court rulings (for inheritance cases).
A certified legal power of attorney (if the application is submitted by a legal representative).
The application must be submitted to the Registration Review Office at the General Directorate of Real Estate Affairs.
Real estate registration fees are calculated based on the current market value of the property as approved by the Ministry of Finance for transactions (sale - gift - exchange).
Fees for sale, gift, or exchange based on the prevailing value of the Ministry of Finance.
In the case of a mortgage, the registration fee is calculated based on the amount of the debt (the value of the mortgage loan).
Additional charges apply: technical fees, stamps, and administrative costs.
The duration for issuing the title deed is from one week to one month.
Duration of determination, release and secretion: 1.5 to 4 months.
Certified sales contract: signed by the seller.
Sales tax receipt: Paid at the Ministry of Finance.
Financial clearance certificate (real estate clearance certificate).
ID photos: for the seller and the buyer.
A certified legal power of attorney if there is an agent.
The original title deed.
Court referral (for legal claims: confirmation of sale).
Fees: Sale price + registration fee + stamps.
Duration: 10 days to one month.
Property registration statement.
Certified survey plan: recent and approved.
Area statement / Topographic plan.
Identity photos and property transfer documents.
Procedures:
Submit an application to the relevant department + pay the audit fees / initial fees.
The file was referred to the technical/surveying office to prepare the subdivision plan.
Notify the neighbors and conduct a site inspection.
Approval of the final plan from the real estate registry and its registration in the records.
Fees: Auditing fees and technical fees.
Duration: 1 to 3 months.

BoundaryModification.service: Boundary modification, property consolidation, and re-demarcation (surveying, technical, and legal work)
requirements: The real estate registry, the real estate office for site inspection and preparation of the boundary report.
Ratification of the amendment and its entry into the real estate registry.
Fees: Determined based on artwork and working hours.
Duration: 3 weeks - 2 months.

RegistrationAndClearance.service: Registration and clearance of the record (mortgage, seizure, and impediments to disposal)
requirements: Placing or removing a lien (mortgage in favor of a bank - claim lien).
Mortgage registration: A mortgage contract or debt instrument.
Signature recording: A court referral or judicial ruling.
Undoing the sign (cancellation): Court ruling - payment/receipt, or proof of settlement.
Duration: 10 days - 2 weeks.

InheritanceAndTransferToHeirs.service: Inheritance and transfer of ownership to heirs
requirements: Death certificate, certified legal inheritance certificate, and civil registration statement.
Submitting documents to the land registry to transfer ownership or distribute shares based on the inheritance inventory.
Fees: Based on property value (percentage) and transaction type.
Duration: 2 weeks - 3 months.

PropertyOwnershipDocs.service: Documents required for property ownership by Arabs and foreigners in Syria
requirements: The ownership application must be submitted by the concerned party or his legal representative to the General Directorate of Civil Affairs office at the Ministry of Interior, accompanied by the following documents.

A real estate registration (ownership deed) for the property to be registered issued by the Real Estate Affairs Directorate in the location of the property, or a statement from the housing association proving the membership of the concerned party and his entitlement to a residential apartment (for Arabs and Palestinians).
A statement issued by the relevant municipality clarifying the area of ​​the property and whether it is eligible for subdivision into layers or not.

A civil registration statement for the applicant, duly certified by the Syrian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Expatriates, or a copy of a civil registration issued by the General Authority for Palestinian Arab Refugees (GAPAR).
(For Palestinians) A copy of the residence permit card.
A civil registration statement for the owner, or a copy of his personal identification card.
The title deed concluded between the owner and the applicant (initial sale contract).
A pledge document (according to the attached form), affixed with legal stamps, signed by the concerned party personally or his legal representative in the presence of the competent employee.
A statement from the temporary registry confirms that the applicant for the license does not own any other property.
Implementation time: ranges from 20 days to a month and a half.
Estimated fees: 500,000 to 105,000,000 SYP + stamps.
Estimated fees: Financial stamp and Red Crescent stamp.

mission.title: Mission
mission.text: Our mission is to simplify paperwork procedures in Syria by providing accurate and efficient remote information solutions that save time, reduce complexity, and eliminate the need for a physical presence.

vision.title: Vision
vision.text: To become the leading company in remote areas for paperwork and administrative services in Syria, making official transactions accessible, simple and reliable from anywhere in the world.

leadership.title: Our Leadership
leadership.text: Mr. Alkasmi is a results-driven professional with extensive experience in Damascus, Dubai, and international markets. His background spans systems management, business processes, and cross-border operations, giving him a deep and practical understanding of how things work in practice. With a keen eye for detail and a strategic mindset, Mr. Alkasmi is known for his ability to navigate complex procedures efficiently and deliver reliable solutions. His ambition goes beyond routine services—he is driven by a clear vision to build a high-standard, trustworthy company that sets new benchmarks in the industry. Guided by experience, integrity, and continuous growth, Mr. Alkasmi is committed to delivering the best possible results for every client.

steps.p: Make Government Services Seamless and Accessible
Enhance Client Experience through Seamless Integration
Promote Business Excellence and Client Success

contact.title: Get in Touch
contact.description: Send us a message and we’ll get back to you within 24 hours!
